explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Stable to water. (The value of aqueous solubility is acquired.) In addition, HSDB (2003) has a statement that solution heat (1.1*10^5J/kg) occurs.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods suitable for a solids material are not established. In addition, ICSC (J) (1999) have the description "it corrodes much metal, such as iron, aluminum and zinc under presence of water, and toxic fumes (arsenic, arsine) is generated".

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Category 2 based on SPECIES: Rat; ENDPOINT: LD50; VALUE: 14mg/kg; REFERENCE SOURCE: HSDB (2003)

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: This product was set to Category 2 from description with redness, the pain which stimulated the skin (ICSC(J), 1999; SITTIG, 4th, 2002).

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Since there are the descriptions that this product irritates to the eye, causes redness and pain (ICSC(J)1999; HSDB, 2003; SITTIG, 4th, 2002), it was classified into Category 2B.

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitization: Classification not possible; Skin sensitization: Classification not possible
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitization: no data available. Skin sensitization : although there is no data of this substance itself, skin sensitization may be indicated to humans as an inorganic arsenic, but it is not a deterministic conclusion (ATSDR, 2005; HSG, 1992), in addition, it was presupposed that it cannot classify from the description in the humans of EHC 224 (2001) "development of the skin sensitization of inorganic arsenic is rare" since data is insufficient.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Without data. In addition, arsenic and inorganic arsenic compound are classified into the germ-cell mutagenicity category 3A (equivalent for GHS Category 1B-2) according to DFG (MAK/BAT, 2005).

carcinogenicity.hazard_statement: May cause cancer (state route of exposure if it is conclusively proven that no other routes of exposure cause the hazard)
carcinogenicity.rationale: Since arsenic and arsenic compound are categorized into the human carcinogens in IARC Suppl.7 (1987), ACGHI-TLV (2004), and MAK/BAT (2004), it was classified into Category 1A.

toxic_to_reproduction.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the undorn child
toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: In "a possibility that the human baby will cause malformation in an animal experiments" in ICSC (J) (1999) of Priority 2 document, and in ACGIH (7th, 2001), ATSDR (draft, 2005), EHC 224 (2001), and DFGOT Vol.21 (2005), although there was an opposite report, the reproductive and developmental toxicity knowledge by inorganic arsenic was indicated to laboratory animals. So it was considered as Category 2.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification: Category 1 (digestive system, cardiovascular system, nervous system, kidneys, liver, respiratory)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs (digestive system, cardiovascular system, nervous system, kidneys, liver, respiratory)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: The substance was classified as Category 1 (gastrointestinal system, cardio-vascular system, nervous system, kidneys, liver, respiratory system). Based on the following reports that it affects gastrointestinal tracts, cardio-vascular system, central nervous systems and kidneys, and may cause serious gastroenteritis, body fluid and electrolyte losses, cardiac and renal obstacle, collapse and shock (ICSC (J) 1999), and that in the forms of the arsenic and inorganic arsenic compounds it causes "symptoms in the gastrointestinal organs, disorders in the functions of the cardio-vascular and nervous systems, myelosuppression, alteration in the blood system and nephropathy" in humans (EHC 224 (2001)), and that it affects the liver, upper airways and lungs (ACGIH (7th, 2001)).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.classification: Category 1 (digestive system, cardiovascular system, nervous system, kidneys, liver, blood system, skin, respiratory organs)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Causes damage to organs (digestive system, cardiovascular system, nervous system, kidneys, liver, blood system, skin, respiratory organs) through prolonged or repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Since this product itself affects the peripheral nervous system, the skin, mucosa, marrow, the kidney, and liver, and may occure neuropathy, pigmentation disorder, nasal septal perforation, damege to blood cells, kidney disorders, and cirrhosis (ICSC (J) 1999), and the description in human of EHC 224 (2001) about arsenic and inorganic arsenics compounds, "the disorders of gastrointestinal, neuropathy, and the effect on blood systems, abnormalities of a cardiovascular systems, the kidney, and liver were observed. Target organ are gastrointestinal,heart,brains and kidney. Skin,marrow and peripheral nerves were also affected ", and in addition, based on description with the effect of the top respiratory tract and lungs on influenced (ACGIH (7th, 2001)), it was classified into Category 1 (digestive systems,cardiovascular systems,nervous systems,kidney, liver, blood systems, skin, respiratory system) .

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data
